summary: the porcine reproductive and respiratory syndrome virus (PRRSV) is classified in the order Nidovirales, family Arteriviridae and genus Arterivirus. the virus is classified in the order Nidovirales, family Arteriviridae and genus Arterivirus, with the prototype virus Equine Arterivirus (EAV) and two other members, lactate dehydrogenase elevating virus (LDV) ribosomal frameshift (RFS) products pp1a-nsp2N, pp1a-nsp2TF are autoproteolytically cleaved into at least 16 nonstructural proteins (nsps) associated with virus replication and transcription. nsp1 (papain-like cysteine protease), nsp2 (chymotrypsin-like cysteine protease) and nsp the characterization of nsp11 immunogenicity remains unclear. nsp11 can induce humoral immune response in PRRSV infected pigs. nsp11 is also responsible for different expression level of TNF-. the Laboratory Animal Ethical Committee of China Agricultural University has approved this research protocol. Virus, plasmids, cells and serum samples PRRSV genotype 1 strain GZ11-G1 and genotype 2 strain JXwn06 were used for cell inoculation in IFA and WB tests. pig serum samples collected from PRRSV inoculation trial or from pig farms were confirmed to be PRRSV positive or negative. the constructed His-fused nsp11 expressing plasmid pET28a-nsp11 was validated by DNA sequencing. nsp11-F GC GGATCC protein expression. pellets were washed twice by using 1x phosphate-buffered saline (PBS), followed by centrifugation for harvest. recombinant nsp1140-223aa protein emulsified with Freund's complete adjuvant. booster vaccinations carried out twice via peritoneum at 3 and 6 weeks. mice were euthanized by cervical dislocation and spleen cells fused with SP2/0 myeloma cells using polyethylene glycol (PEG 1450) 96-well plate (Costar, Corning Incorporated) coated overnight with the purified His-nsp1140-223aa protein (0.4ug/well) were blocked for 2 h with 5% (wt/vol) skim milk in PBS at 37°C followed by three times wash with PBST. the plates were then incubated with 100 uL diluted nsp11 mouse antisera or supernatants of hybridoma at 37°C e with the amino acid sequence of DCREY were cross-linked to 96-well Maxisorp plates. peptides were coated with 50 g/ml poly-L-lysine using 0.1% glutaraldehyde. plates were blocked with 1 mol/L glycine at room temperature for 1 h. screened PRRSV positive or negative serum samples were diluted with blocking buffer. FITC-conjugated goat anti-mouse IgG washed three times with PBS. the stained cells were visualized with a fluorescence microscope fitted with a camera. western blotting was performed as following, the transfected HEK 293 cells were incubated with anti-nsp11 mAb 3F9. a student t test was used to analyze the significant difference of OD value between positive and negative serum samples. differences were analyzed by GraphPad Prism software (version 5.0) expression vector pET28a and pEGFP-N1 were previously constructed or purchased in the lab [28]. pET28a-nsp11 expressing plasmid was validated by nsp11-T2-9 F GCCTTTACTTGTACAG nsp11-T2-6-1 F GCCTCTTTACTTGTACAG nsp11-T2-6-2 F GCCTCTTTACT the plasmid pET28a-nsp11 was transformed into Escherichia coli BL21 (DE3) competent cells for protein expression. the plasmid pET28a-nsp11 was transformed into Escherichia coli BL21 (DE3) competent cells for protein expression. soluble and insoluble fractions of his-nsp1140-223aa were divided by centrifugation at 12,000 rpm, 4°C for 10 min. soluble and insoluble fractions of his-nsp1140-223aa were divided by centrifugation at 12,000 rpm, 4°C for 10 min. the supernatant of the hybridomas was screened for secreting nsp11-specific antibodies with indirect enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA) positive hybridomas were subcloned three rounds by limiting dilution, before using to produce ascites fluid by intraperitoneal injection of 5 105 hybridoma cells into female BALB/c mice treated with 0.5 ml/mouse 2,6,10,14-tetramethylpentade the bound antibodies were detected with HRP-conjugated goat anti-mouse IgG (1: 5000 dilutions in PBST) after another 1 h inoculation and three times washing, the reaction was quantified by detecting the absorbance at 450 nm using 3, 3′, 5, 5′-Tetramethylbenzidine (TMB) as a substrate. the hybridoma supernatant of screened monoclonal antibody and HRP-conjugated goat anti-mouse lgG were also used to test the reaction with coated peptides. at 36 h post-inoculation, cells were fixed with 80% acetone and treated with 0.1% Triton X-100 (Sigma–Aldrich) at room temperature for 10 min, followed by blocking with 2% BSA for 30 min, and then incuba the truncated proteins were verified the reactivity with anti-nsp11 mAb 3F9 by western blotting. at the final round, fragments with only 6aa or 7 aa were tested in WB to identify the accurate position of epitope. epitope was conserved among different genotypes of PRRSV. the sequence of epitope region was analyzed by using DNASTAR software. expression and purification of His-tagged nsp1140-223aa protein was successfully expressed in E coli BL21 cells with the expected size of 26 kDa. mAb 3F9 belongs to subclass IgG1/-type. the hybridoma cells clone was identified by testing supernatants. mAb 3F9 belongs to subclass IgG1/-type. nsp11 was finally divided into eight fragments with at least 6 amino acid overlapped among neighbors. all fragments from T2-6-B to T2-6-F could be recognized by mAb 3F9 respectively. the rest T2-6-A, G and H could not, which indicates that the “DCREY” covered 111-115aa of nsp11 is the minimal core unit of epitope recognized by mAb 3F9. ELISAs were performed using either His-nsp1140-223aa or synthetic peptide 111DCREY115 as coating antigens. the nsp11 specific antibody in anti-PRRSV sera was detected by reacting with nsp1140-223aa protein in WB test. nsp11 epitope 111DCREY115 was highly conserved between the two genotypes. nsp11 epitope 111DCREY115 was highly conserved between the two genotypes, but not conserved among Arterivirus. the identified epitope recognized by 3F9 is exposed on the surface of the nsp11 structure. the identified epitope was labeled in the sequence chain view picture of PRRSV nsp11. expression and purification of His-tagged nsp1140-223aa protein was successfully expressed in E coli BL21 cells. p1140-223aa protein was used to immunize BALB/c mice to generate hybridoma cells secreting antibodies specifically against the PRRSV nsp11. an hybridoma cells clone, named as 3F9, was identified by testing its supernatants using PRRSV nsp11-specific indirect ELISA. the mAb 3F9 recognized T2 fragment covered 84-133aa of nsp11 was further divided into nine overlapped shorter fragments to test with mAb 3F9. the screened out fragment T2-6, covered 109-118aa of nsp11, was finally divided into eight fragments with at least 6 amino acid overlapped among neighbors. all fragments from T2-6-B to T2-6-F could be recognized by mAb 3F9 respectively, the expressed His-nsp1140-223aa protein could be recognized by anti-PRRSV sera, but it did not react with PRRSV negative sera. ELISAs were performed using either His-nsp1140-223aa or synthetic peptide 111DCREY115 as coating antigens. the results indicate that PRRSV nsp11 could induce the humoral immunity responds in pig during PRRSV infection. the 111DCREY115 epitope specific antibody in anti-PRRSV sera were detected by peptide coated indirect ELISA. nsp11 epitope 111DCREY115 was highly conserved between the two genotypes, but not conserved among Arterivirus. nsp11 was obtained from the Protein Data Bank (PDB) with the ID 5EYI. the identified epitope is found to locate at the region without secondary structure assigned or bend region. the spatial distribution was also analyzed on the 3D structure model of PRRSV nsp11 by using PyMOL software. the core unit 111DCREY115 was found to be conserved in both genotypes of PRRSV, but not in Arterivirus. only three residues “REY” at 113-115aa were conserved in PRRSV, LDV and HSFV. a novel mAb 3F9 against the nsp11 of PRRSV was generated. the core motif 111DCREY115 of its specific B-cell epitope, which is conserved in both genotypes of PRRSV, was successfully identified.
